Interface Application

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        the name of this application

      • isStateless

        boolean isStateless()

      • getKnownModelNames

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getKnownModelNames()

      • lookupModel

        java.lang.Object lookupModel(java.lang.String modelName,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> connectParameters)
        Lookup a model by one or more (application specific) connect parameters. Typical parameters are:
        • username
        • browser cookie
        • device id
        • ...
        Applications are free to just return null on every call to this method. Returning null is the expected behaviour for applications that do not support restoring (user) sessions.
        Parameters:
        modelName - name of model
        connectParameters - lookup criteria
        Returns:
        existing Model instance or null if there is no matching model yet

      • createModel

        java.lang.Object createModel(java.lang.String modelName,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> connectParameters,
                           RefContext refContext)
        Create a new instance of a model root that matches the given model name and the (application specific) connect parameters.
        Parameters:
        modelName - name of model
        connectParameters - (optional) connect parameters
        refContext - RefContext for the corresponding ModelSession
        Returns:
        newly created model root

      • releaseModel

        void releaseModel(java.lang.String modelName,
                java.lang.Object modelRoot)
        Free all resources that might have been allocated for the given model.
        Parameters:
        modelName - name of model
        modelRoot - root of model instance to free

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Free all resources associated by this Application.
